channel.title: Changing NPC gender?
channel.description:
So i was looking at this tut on how to create an NPC, and i'm note sure what part of the coding determines the npc's gender. Please take a look at the short tut and see if you know. Any help would be greatly appriciated
Here's the tut: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,510281.0.html

item.title: Changing NPC gender?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Definitely. Although, I may have over complicated it. You wouldn’t need to change EVERY Npc definition in the cache, but you SHOULD for the sake of consistency. All you would really need to do is add an otherwise unused definition opcode, and process from there.

EDIT: Actually, you could accomplish this much easier with some protocol hackery. All you would need to do is add a new packet, with the modified model ids for the Npc (much like the player’s appearance block).

Read full topic

item.title: Changing NPC gender?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:6, topic:439017”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=541717.msg3968615#msg3968615 date=1333952053]
But not sure that would work because wouldn’t it have to apply/work for all the entities listed as NPCs?

For example don’t think you can make the shark fin smaller on a shark smaller, and there are some pretty weird things like animated axes

Then again you can symbolize male and female with size differences? Not sure how it would work or why you’d need it but just a thought
[/quote]

It’s certainly possible, but it would require changing the format of the NPC data in the cache. Even then, it doesn’t necessarily need to be restricted to genders. I remember when I was modding Halo 2 maps, there were flags for the permutation of the Banshee (Normal or Heretic), and all it did was load a different image as the skin. The same could be applied here, but instead of skins, the models for the head, torso, legs, arms, etc.[/quote]
Still a lot more work than the OP realized.

Read full topic

For example don’t think you can make the shark fin smaller on a shark smaller, and there are some pretty weird things like animated axes

Then again you can symbolize male and female with size differences? Not sure how it would work or why you’d need it but just a thought[/quote]

It’s certainly possible, but it would require changing the format of the NPC data in the cache. Even then, it doesn’t necessarily need to be restricted to genders. I remember when I was modding Halo 2 maps, there were flags for the permutation of the Banshee (Normal or Heretic), and all it did was load a different image as the skin. The same could be applied here, but instead of skins, the models for the head, torso, legs, arms, etc.

item.title: Changing NPC gender?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

As stated “genders” don’t really exist in the client. Granted, you could add a gender flag relatively easily. The only thing that changes are the models. (Female models are generally thinner, have breasts, etc).

Read full topic

item.title: Changing NPC gender?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

Would be about as easy as changing the gender for a tree model.

Also, wrong section.
This Belongs in ‘Client Help’.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing NPC gender?
item.dc:creator: @hasumon hasumon
item.description:
@hasumon wrote:

[quote=“Carnifex12, post:1, topic:439017”]So i was looking at this tut on how to create an NPC, and i’m note sure what part of the coding determines the npc’s gender. Please take a look at the short tut and see if you know. Any help would be greatly appriciated

Here’s the tut:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,510281.0.html[/quote]
There is no such thing as a gender factor to making an NPC. You can, in fact, call ‘cat’ as a gender if you allow it.

Read full topic
